Files

fdt_parser/cache/
fdt.rs

1//! Cached FDT parser with indexed lookups.
2//!
3//! This module provides the `Fdt` type for the cached parser, which builds
4//! internal indices for fast path-based and phandle-based node lookups.
5
6use alloc::{
7    collections::{btree_map::BTreeMap, btree_set::BTreeSet},
8    string::{String, ToString},
9    sync::Arc,
10    vec::Vec,
11};
12
13use super::{Align4Vec, Node};
14use crate::{base, cache::NodeMeta, data::Raw, FdtError, Header, Phandle};
15
16/// Cached Flattened Device Tree parser.
17///
18/// This parser builds internal indices (path cache, phandle cache, compatible cache)
19/// during construction, providing O(1) lookup time for subsequent queries.
20/// It uses more memory than the base parser but is much faster for repeated lookups.
21#[derive(Clone)]
22pub struct Fdt {
23    pub(super) inner: Arc<Inner>,
24}
25
26impl Fdt {
27    /// Create a new `Fdt` from byte slice.
28    ///
29    /// This will parse the entire device tree and build internal indices.
30    pub fn from_bytes(data: &[u8]) -> Result<Fdt, FdtError> {
31        let inner = Inner::new(data)?;
32        Ok(Self {
33            inner: Arc::new(inner),
34        })
35    }
36
37    /// Returns a slice of the underlying FDT data.
38    pub fn as_slice(&self) -> &[u8] {
39        &self.inner.raw
40    }
41
42    /// Create a new `Fdt` from a raw pointer and size in bytes.
43    ///
44    /// # Safety
45    ///
46    /// The caller must ensure that the pointer is valid and points to a
47    /// memory region of at least `size` bytes that contains a valid device tree
48    /// blob.
49    pub unsafe fn from_ptr(ptr: *mut u8) -> Result<Fdt, FdtError> {
50        let b = base::Fdt::from_ptr(ptr)?;
51        Self::from_bytes(b.raw())
52    }
53
54    pub(super) fn fdt_base<'a>(&'a self) -> base::Fdt<'a> {
55        base::Fdt::from_bytes(&self.inner.raw).unwrap()
56    }
57
58    /// Get the FDT version.
59    pub fn version(&self) -> u32 {
60        self.fdt_base().version()
61    }
62
63    /// Get the FDT header.
64    pub fn header(&self) -> Header {
65        self.fdt_base().header().clone()
66    }
67
68    /// Get all nodes in the device tree.
69    pub fn all_nodes(&self) -> Vec<Node> {
70        self.inner
71            .all_nodes
72            .iter()
73            .map(|meta| Node::new(self, meta))
74            .collect()
75    }
76
77    /// Find nodes by path or alias.
78    ///
79    /// If path starts with '/' then search by path, else search by aliases.
80    pub fn find_nodes(&self, path: impl AsRef<str>) -> Vec<Node> {
81        let path = path.as_ref();
82        let path = if path.starts_with("/") {
83            path.to_string()
84        } else {
85            self.find_aliase(path).unwrap()
86        };
87        let mut out = Vec::new();
88        for node in self.all_nodes() {
89            if node.full_path().starts_with(path.as_str()) {
90                let right = node.full_path().trim_start_matches(&path);
91                if right.split("/").count() < 2 {
92                    out.push(node);
93                }
94            }
95        }
96
97        out
98    }
99
100    /// Find an alias by name.
101    pub fn find_aliase(&self, name: impl AsRef<str>) -> Option<String> {
102        let fdt = self.fdt_base();
103        let s = fdt.find_aliase(name.as_ref()).ok()?;
104        Some(s.into())
105    }
106
107    /// Get a node by its phandle (O(1) lookup).
108    pub fn get_node_by_phandle(&self, phandle: Phandle) -> Option<Node> {
109        let meta = self.inner.get_node_by_phandle(phandle)?;
110        Some(Node::new(self, &meta))
111    }
112
113    /// Find nodes with compatible strings matching the given list.
114    pub fn find_compatible(&self, with: &[&str]) -> Vec<Node> {
115        let mut ids = BTreeSet::new();
116        for &c in with {
117            if let Some(s) = self.inner.compatible_cache.get(c) {
118                for n in s {
119                    ids.insert(n);
120                }
121            }
122        }
123        let mut out = Vec::new();
124        for id in ids {
125            if let Some(meta) = self.inner.get_node_by_index(*id) {
126                out.push(Node::new(self, &meta));
127            }
128        }
129
130        out
131    }
132
133    /// Get all memory reservation blocks.
134    pub fn memory_reservation_blocks(&self) -> Vec<crate::MemoryRegion> {
135        let fdt = self.fdt_base();
136        fdt.memory_reservation_blocks().collect()
137    }
138
139    /// Get raw access to the FDT data.
140    pub fn raw<'a>(&'a self) -> Raw<'a> {
141        Raw::new(&self.inner.raw)
142    }
143
144    /// Get a node by its path in the device tree (O(1) lookup).
145    pub fn get_node_by_path(&self, path: &str) -> Option<Node> {
146        let meta = self.inner.get_node_by_path(path)?;
147        Some(Node::new(self, &meta))
148    }
149
150    /// Get all memory nodes.
151    pub fn memory(&self) -> Result<Vec<super::node::Memory>, FdtError> {
152        let nodes = self.find_nodes("/memory");
153        let mut out = Vec::new();
154        for node in nodes {
155            let super::Node::Memory(m) = node else {
156                return Err(FdtError::NodeNotFound("memory"));
157            };
158            out.push(m);
159        }
160        Ok(out)
161    }
162}
163
164/// Internal cached representation of the FDT.
165///
166/// Contains the raw FDT data plus various indices for fast lookups.
167pub(super) struct Inner {
168    raw: Align4Vec,
169    phandle_cache: BTreeMap<Phandle, usize>,
170    /// compatible -> set(name)
171    compatible_cache: BTreeMap<String, BTreeSet<usize>>,
172    /// same order as all_nodes()
173    all_nodes: Vec<NodeMeta>,
174    path_cache: BTreeMap<String, usize>,
175}
176
177unsafe impl Send for Inner {}
178unsafe impl Sync for Inner {}
179
180impl Inner {
181    /// Build the cached representation from raw FDT data.
182    fn new(data: &[u8]) -> Result<Self, FdtError> {
183        let b = base::Fdt::from_bytes(data)?;
184        let mut inner = Inner {
185            raw: Align4Vec::new(data),
186            phandle_cache: BTreeMap::new(),
187            compatible_cache: BTreeMap::new(),
188            all_nodes: Vec::new(),
189            path_cache: BTreeMap::new(),
190        };
191        let mut node_vec = Vec::new();
192        let mut path_stack = Vec::new();
193        let mut node_stack: Vec<NodeMeta> = Vec::new();
194        for (i, node) in b.all_nodes().enumerate() {
195            let node = node?;
196            let node_name = node.name();
197            let level = node.level();
198
199            while let Some(last) = node_stack.last() {
200                if level <= last.level {
201                    node_stack.pop();
202                } else {
203                    break;
204                }
205            }
206
207            if level < path_stack.len() {
208                path_stack.truncate(level);
209            }
210            path_stack.push(node_name.trim_start_matches("/"));
211            let full_path = if path_stack.len() > 1 {
212                alloc::format!("/{}", path_stack[1..].join("/"))
213            } else {
214                "/".to_string()
215            };
216            for prop in node.properties() {
217                let _ = prop?;
218            }
219            let parent = node_stack.last();
220            let dnode = NodeMeta::new(&node, full_path.clone(), parent);
221            node_stack.push(dnode.clone());
222            inner.all_nodes.push(dnode.clone());
223            inner.path_cache.insert(full_path, i);
224
225            match node.phandle() {
226                Ok(phandle) => {
227                    inner.phandle_cache.entry(phandle).or_insert(i);
228                }
229                Err(FdtError::NotFound) => {}
230                Err(e) => return Err(e),
231            }
232            match node.compatibles_flatten() {
233                Ok(iter) => {
234                    for compatible in iter {
235                        let map = inner.compatible_cache.entry(compatible.into()).or_default();
236                        map.insert(i);
237                    }
238                }
239                Err(FdtError::NotFound) => {}
240                Err(e) => return Err(e),
241            }
242            node_vec.push(node);
243        }
244
245        Ok(inner)
246    }
247
248    pub(crate) fn get_node_by_path(&self, path: &str) -> Option<NodeMeta> {
249        let idx = self.path_cache.get(path)?;
250        Some(self.all_nodes[*idx].clone())
251    }
252
253    fn get_node_by_index(&self, index: usize) -> Option<NodeMeta> {
254        self.all_nodes.get(index).cloned()
255    }
256
257    fn get_node_by_phandle(&self, phandle: Phandle) -> Option<NodeMeta> {
258        let idx = self.phandle_cache.get(&phandle)?;
259        Some(self.all_nodes[*idx].clone())
260    }
261}
